abstract.p: Photos of colorful print party trousers on men attending benefit for Southampton Hospital (On the Street column)

block.p: In the Hamptons, the sartorial style of a few men is changing party dressing for outdoor benefits. At last week's Southampton Hospital party, attended by 1,200 guests, 80 percent of the men wore the Hamptons uniform of navy blazers and white trousers, bottom row. A few men turned heads in their colorful chinoiserie and toile de Jouy cotton print trousers, but not since the Shep Miller men's shop on Job's Lane in Southampton introduced vibrant-color trousers and jackets as a Hamptons look in the 1940's have so many men dared to wear such colorful pants, these made by Steven Stolman's Southampton shop. And farther off the beaten path is the young man, far right, in a sarong.
